segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 14. Devadahavagga
segments.en: 14. At Devadaha

segments.pli: 135. Khaṇasutta
segments.en: 135. Opportunity

segments.pli: “Lābhā vo, bhikkhave, suladdhaṃ vo, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “You’re fortunate, mendicants, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: khaṇo vo paṭiladdho brahmacariyavāsāya.
segments.en: to have the opportunity to live the spiritual life.

segments.pli: Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, chaphassāyatanikā nāma nirayā.
segments.en: I’ve seen the hell called ‘the six fields of contact’.

segments.pli: Tattha yaṃ kiñci cakkhunā rūpaṃ passati aniṭṭharūpaṃyeva passati, no iṭṭharūpaṃ; akantarūpaṃyeva passati, no kantarūpaṃ; amanāparūpaṃyeva passati, no manāparūpaṃ.
segments.en: There, whatever sight you see with your eye is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sotena saddaṃ suṇāti … pe …
segments.en: Whatever sound you hear …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyati … pe …
segments.en: Whatever odor you smell …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci jivhāya rasaṃ sāyati … pe …
segments.en: Whatever flavor you taste …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusati … pe …
segments.en: Whatever touch you feel …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci manasā dhammaṃ vijānāti aniṭṭharūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no iṭṭharūpaṃ; akantarūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no kantarūpaṃ; amanāparūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no manāparūpaṃ.
segments.en: Whatever thought you know with your mind is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.

segments.pli: Lābhā vo, bhikkhave, suladdhaṃ vo, bhikkhave,
segments.en: You’re fortunate, mendicants, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: khaṇo vo paṭiladdho brahmacariyavāsāya.
segments.en: to have the opportunity to live the spiritual life.

segments.pli: Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, chaphassāyatanikā nāma saggā.
segments.en: I’ve seen the heaven called ‘the six fields of contact’.

segments.pli: Tattha yaṃ kiñci cakkhunā rūpaṃ passati iṭṭharūpaṃyeva passati, no aniṭṭharūpaṃ; kantarūpaṃyeva passati, no akantarūpaṃ; manāparūpaṃyeva passati, no amanāparūpaṃ … pe …
segments.en: There, whatever sight you see with your eye is likable, not unlikable; desirable, not undesirable; pleasant, not unpleasant.

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci jivhāya rasaṃ sāyati … pe …
segments.en: Whatever sound … odor … flavor … touch …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci manasā dhammaṃ vijānāti iṭṭharūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no aniṭṭharūpaṃ; kantarūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no akantarūpaṃ; manāparūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no amanāparūpaṃ.
segments.en: Whatever thought you know with your mind is likable, not unlikable; desirable, not undesirable; pleasant, not unpleasant.

segments.pli: Lābhā vo, bhikkhave, suladdhaṃ vo, bhikkhave,
segments.en: You’re fortunate, mendicants, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: khaṇo vo paṭiladdho brahmacariyavāsāyā”ti.
segments.en: to have the opportunity to live the spiritual life.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha speaks of the hell named the “six senses” where all one experiences is sheer pain and unpleasantness.
